info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 7:32AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...BE ALERT FOR MINOR FLOODING IN WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS AND NORTHERN CONNECTICUT... HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Showers and thunderstorms will produce heavy rain as they track across western Massachusetts and northern Connecticut. Rainfall rates of up to 1 inch per hour are likely. Morning commuters along Interstates 84 and 91 and the Mass Pike should be prepared for low visibility and ponding of water on roads. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Hartford, West Hartford, Manchester, Chicopee, East Hartford, Enfield, Westfield, Holyoke, Amherst, Vernon, Windsor, Northampton, Agawam, West Springfield, South Windsor, Greenfield, Orange, Deerfield and Simsbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
